column4: I have 2 ubuntu machines and an ethernet cable. How can I get files from one to the other?
I have a cheap laptop form last year and an old desktop from 2002
just plug the cable into both computers, and do tail /var/log/dmesg
whats the problem that you're having? if I recall correct, you're trying to transfer files between two computers directly connected with an ethernet cable?
That's what I want to do
Both machines have IP addresses on the same subnet?
I don't know
back to basics, I suppose.  Make sure that one of your cards can do auto-crossover
I have no idea
from the laptop: traceroute ip_of_desktop
you may not have traceroute installed, if you don't, sudo apt-get install traceroute
E: Couldn't find package traceroot
xlq: http://paste.ubuntu.com/252771/
can you pastebin the output of ifconfig /all from both machines?
The desktop has no internet
/all: error fetching interface information: Device not found
is that from the desktop?
both
ifconfig will suffice :)
from the laptop: http://paste.ubuntu.com/252774/
is it the same except for the IP address on the desktop?
The desktop has no IP
